title: Why I am quitting LOL after three years
body:
I first started playing LOL few months after Kindred came out (I remember her log in screen). All of my friends told me how fun the game was, and at first, it was. Then I started playing by myself and learned how brutal this game was if you made mistakes or failed

Even when I got used to the basic knowledge of the game, I could never find myself improving. I wasn't playing to have fun (rather couldn't have fun) nor was I playing to climb the elo. I was stuck in bronze for all three seasons I've tried. And that's where I had my limit. I just saw myself giving up on learning a champion if I didn't do well in 20 games. I sucked at 90% of all the champions I've tried (all lanes), and even with 10% of the champions, I was good with I couldn't climb the elo because I was simply terrible at this game. Hell, my rank actually WENT DOWN from b3 to b4.

So then, you may ask "Well why don't you play for fun, not to climb?" Well, for me the definition of "having fun" is playing a champion that I am good at from the get-go. If I was feeding, not carrying, or failing my role, I just got mad and started to say some really mean shit to my teammates and even my friends.

Finally, I was one of those people who were the first people to start the surrender vote or vote yes when someone else did. I didn't and still don't believe in comebacks, especially when the enemy team knocked all of our towers, 3/5 are dead, and they are about to get the mid inhibitor. I yelled at my team for wasting time and called them idiots for not seeing a loss.

I am actually asking myself wtf have I been doing with past 3 years of my life. I will probably move on to other games that are currently meta (Fornite and overwatch, here I come), but I don't think I will EVER look back at this game.

TL;DR
Wasn't having fun nor improving. Got angered easily especially when the team didn't surrender an obvious losing game
